intro: Diasperus antillanus, commonly known as the Antillean spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique botanical features. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small and clustered, with a distinctive cyathium structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
